data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Grotle
data.flavorText: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Torterra
data.flavorText: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra's back and spend their entire life there.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rumble Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a set of three. When they sleep, they gather up and form a giant hive of 100 Combee.

attacks.name: Sting Missile
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.

attacks.name: Gather Order
attacks.text: Search your deck for as many Combee as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Damage Beat
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.flavorText: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

data.name: Cherubi
data.flavorText: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cherrim
data.flavorText: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

abilities.name: Fair-Weather Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Swadloon
data.flavorText: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.

attacks.name: Swaddle Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Leavanny
data.flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

attacks.name: Cleave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Foongus
data.flavorText: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.name: Amoonguss
data.flavorText: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Maractus
data.flavorText: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Moltres-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Destructive Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Flame
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Monferno
data.flavorText: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

attacks.name: Loud Howl
attacks.text: Your opponent Switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Infernape
data.flavorText: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hand and feet. It will take on any opponent.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attack. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Malevolent Fire
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Chimchar
data.flavorText: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

data.name: Victini-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Energize
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

attacks.name: Double Fire
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flame Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

abilities.name: Freefloating
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

attacks.name: Luring Flame
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fiery Licks
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Fire Energy cards discarded.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Swinub
data.flavorText: Rooting the tip of its snout into the ground, it searches for food. Sometimes, it even digs up a hot spring.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Articuno-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frost Prison
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Piloswine
data.flavorText: With its excellent sense of smell, it's even able to find mushrooms that are buried under frozen ground.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quintuple Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Mamoswine
data.flavorText: When the temperature rose at the end of the ice age, most Mamoswine disappeared.

attacks.name: Frost Stone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Lotad
data.flavorText: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Ludicolo
data.flavorText: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.text: At any times between turns, heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Groovy Dance
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

data.name: Lombre
data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Sharpedo
data.flavorText: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Manaphy
data.flavorText: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

abilities.name: Final Wish
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Seafaring
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

attacks.name: Snow Squall
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.

data.name: Vanilluxe
data.flavorText: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

attacks.name: Enefountain
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Frillish
data.flavorText: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Jellicent
data.flavorText: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

abilities.name: Spiteful Spirit
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Beartic
data.flavorText: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways around the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.

attacks.name: Powerful Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glacier Drop
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

abilities.name: Dual Brains
abilities.text: During your turn, you may play 2 Supporter cards.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.

attacks.name: Double Assist
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Zapdos-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Powervolt
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

attacks.name: Electribonus
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Trainer cards in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: It creates barriers from electrified silk that stun foes. This works as a weapon as well as a defense.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surrounding while it flies.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surrounding while it flies.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Crobat
data.flavorText: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.

abilities.name: Night Sight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Ultra-Toxic Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on this Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Weezing
data.flavorText: Inhaling toxic fumes from trash and mixing them inside its body lets it spread an even fouler stench.

abilities.name: Aftermath
abilities.text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Smogbank
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Ralts
data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Kirlia
data.flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Gallade
data.flavorText: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift Lunge
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Giratina
data.flavorText: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

attacks.name: Hex
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Shadow Claw
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: Wanting more garbage, they follow people who litter. They always belch poison gas.

attacks.name: Tool Drop
attacks.text: Does 20 damage for each Pokémon Tool card attached to Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Ensnarl
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Colorless in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Double Ducts
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pile Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: Wanting more garbage, they follow people who litter. They always belch poison gas.

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Biosmog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

data.name: Elgyem
data.flavorText: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Elgyem
data.flavorText: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

data.name: Phanpy
data.flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

data.name: Beheeyem
data.flavorText: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven't been decoded.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Damakinesis
attacks.text: Move 6 damage counters from any of your Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Donphan
data.flavorText: It attacks by curling up, then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.

attacks.name: Spinning Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage. Discard the Stadium card.

data.name: Lunatone
data.flavorText: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.

abilities.name: Premonition
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

attacks.name: Heat Burn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 90 damage to itself.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: They communicate with one another using their auras made tangible by their emotions.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Metal Energy attached to it, this Pokémon's type is both Fighting and Metal.

attacks.name: Hurricane Kick
attacks.text: Does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Timburr
data.flavorText: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

data.name: Gurdurr
data.flavorText: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Conkeldurr
data.flavorText: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

attacks.name: Facade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Burned or Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Drain Punch
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Liepard
data.flavorText: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

attacks.name: Silent Claw
attacks.text: Your opponent reveal his or her hand. Discard a Supporter card you find there. Use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Scrafty
data.flavorText: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reinforced Headbutt
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Skarmory
data.flavorText: Its heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.

attacks.name: Cargo Jet
attacks.text: Discard a Team Plasma card from your hand. if you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Klink
data.flavorText: Two bodies comprise a fixed pair. They spin around each other to generate energy.

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Klang
data.flavorText: A minigear and big gear comprises its body. If the minigear it launches at its foe doesn't return, it will die.

attacks.name: Gear Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.

attacks.name: Hard Crunch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Druddigon
data.flavorText: It runs through the narrow tunnels formed by Excadrill and Onix. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Klinklang
data.flavorText: The minigear spins at high speed. Then the energy from the red core charges the minigear to make it ready to fire.

abilities.name: Plasma Steel
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Metal Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Heavy Bullet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.

attacks.name: Call for Backup
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Metal Jail
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cobalion-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Righteous Edge
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Bullet
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Black Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Black Ballista
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: White Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: White Inferno
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

abilities.name: Moon Guidance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with telepathic power.

attacks.name: Gatling Peck
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

attacks.name: Raging Pecks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Togetic
data.flavorText: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kind-hearted people.

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent draws a card.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

abilities.name: Block
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Teampact
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Team Plasma Pokémon you have in play.

data.name: Togepi
data.flavorText: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Togekiss
data.flavorText: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

abilities.name: Bright Veil
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent plays an Item card from his or her hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Whismur
data.flavorText: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

attacks.name: Shout
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Loudred
data.flavorText: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Lugia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Exploud
data.flavorText: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

attacks.name: Destructive Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard all Item cards you find there.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 50 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.name: Patrat
data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Skitty
data.flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Triple Slap
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Bouffalant
data.flavorText: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.

attacks.name: Tool Breaker
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Rufflet
data.flavorText: It stands up to massive opponents, not out of courage, but out of recklessness. But that is how it gets stronger.

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Braviary
data.flavorText: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

abilities.name: Big Wing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wild Edge
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Patrat
data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, there is always one keeping watch, but they don't notice enemies coming from behind.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Watchog
data.flavorText: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Fast Swipe
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Biting Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Watchog
data.flavorText: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Colress Machine
rules: Search your deck for a Plasma Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Team Plasma Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bicycle
rules: Draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Colress
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. (Your opponent switches first. If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, he or she doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ether
rules: Reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If it is not a basic Energy card, return it to the top of your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Plasma Grunt
rules: Discard a Team Plasma card from your card. (if you can't discard a Team Plasma card, you can't play this card.) Draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Eviolite
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is a Basic Pokémon, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Plasma Frigate
rules: Each Pokémon that has any Plasma Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Hypnotoxic Laser
rules: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is also Asleep.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Virbank City Gym
rules: Put 2 more damage counters on Poisoned Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Plasma Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

data.name: Articuno-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frost Prison
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Victory Piece
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to Victini-EX, Victini-EX can use its attacks regardless of the amount or type of Energy attached to it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Dowsing Machine
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Victini-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Energize
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Cobalion-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Righteous Edge
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Bullet
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Blastoise
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Deluge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Colress
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Charizard
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Random Receiver
rules: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Supporter card. Put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Scramble Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, you may move as many Energy attached to the old Active Pokémon to the new Active Pokémon as you like.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Lugia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.
